# Atomic vectors

---

## Logical vectors

```{r}
#| label = "parse-logical",
#| collapse = TRUE
parse_logical(c("TRUE", "TRUE", "FALSE", "TRUE", "NA"))
```

--

## Numeric vectors

```{r}
#| label = "parse-numeric",
#| collapse = TRUE
parse_integer(c("1", "5", "3", "4", "12423"))
parse_double(c("4.2", "4", "6", "53.2"))
```

--

## Character vectors

```{r}
#| label = "parse-character",
#| collapse = TRUE
parse_character(c("Goodnight Moon", "Runaway Bunny", "Big Red Barn"))
```

---

## Scalars

```{r}
#| label = "recycle"
(x <- sample(10))
x + c(100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100)
x + 100
```

---

## Vector recycling

```{r}
#| label = "recycle-bad"
# create a sequence of numbers between 1 and 10
(x1 <- seq(from = 1, to = 2))
(x2 <- seq(from = 1, to = 10))

# add together two sequences of numbers
x1 + x2
```

---

## Subsetting vectors

```{r}
#| label = "subset-vec"
x <- c("one", "two", "three", "four", "five")
```

* With positive integers

```{r}
#| label = "subset-pos",
#| collapse = TRUE
x[c(3, 2, 5)]
```

* With negative integers

```{r}
#| label = "subset-neg",
#| collapse = TRUE
x[c(-1, -3, -5)]
```

* Don't mix positive and negative

```{r}
#| label = "subset-both",
#| collapse = TRUE,
#| error = TRUE
x[c(-1, 1)]
```

---

## Subset with a logical vector

```{r}
#| label = "subset-logic"
(x <- c(10, 3, NA, 5, 8, 1, NA))

# All non-missing values of x
!is.na(x)
x[!is.na(x)]

# All even (or missing!) values of x
x[x %% 2 == 0]
```

# Iteration

---

## Iteration

```{r}
#| label = "df-rnorm"
df <- tibble(
  a = rnorm(10),
  b = rnorm(10),
  c = rnorm(10),
  d = rnorm(10)
)
```

```{r}
#| label = "median-per-column",
#| collapse = TRUE
median(df$a)
median(df$b)
median(df$c)
median(df$d)
```

---

## Iteration three ways

1. `for` loops
1. `map_*()` functions
1. `across()`

---

class: inverse, middle

# Iteration with `for` loops

---

## Iteration with `for` loop

```{r}
#| label = "for-loop"
output <- vector(mode = "double", length = ncol(df))
for (i in seq_along(df)) {
  output[[i]] <- median(df[[i]])
}
output
```

---

## Output

```r
output <- vector(mode = "double", length = ncol(df))
```

```{r}
#| label = "vector",
#| collapse = TRUE
vector(mode = "double", length = ncol(df))
vector(mode = "logical", length = ncol(df))
vector(mode = "character", length = ncol(df))
vector(mode = "list", length = ncol(df))
```

---

## Sequence

```r
i in seq_along(df)
```

```{r}
#| label = "seq-along"
seq_along(df)
```

---

## Body

```r
output[[i]] <- median(df[[i]])
```

---

## Preallocation

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Code]
```r
# no preallocation
mpg_no_preall <- tibble()

for(i in 1:100){
  mpg_no_preall <- bind_rows(mpg_no_preall, mpg)
}

# with preallocation using a list
mpg_preall <- vector(mode = "list", length = 100)

for(i in 1:100){
  mpg_preall[[i]] <- mpg
}

mpg_preall <- bind_rows(mpg_preall)
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[Plot]
```{r}
#| out.width = "70%",
#| echo = FALSE
# load microbenchmark library to time code
library(microbenchmark)

# bind together 100 copies of mpg
times <- microbenchmark(
  `No preallocation` = {
    mpg_no_preall <- tibble()
    
    for(i in 1:100){
      mpg_no_preall <- bind_rows(mpg_no_preall, mpg)
    }
  },
  `Preallocation` = {
    mpg_preall <- vector(mode = "list", length = 100)
    
    for(i in 1:100){
      mpg_preall[[i]] <- mpg
    }
    
    mpg_preall <- bind_rows(mpg_preall)
  }
)

autoplot(times)
```
]
]

# Iteration with `map_*()` functions

---

## Map functions

* Why `for` loops are good
* Why `map()` functions may be better
* Types of `map()` functions
    * `map()` makes a list
    * `map_lgl()` makes a logical vector
    * `map_int()` makes an integer vector
    * `map_dbl()` makes a double vector
    * `map_chr()` makes a character vector

---

## Map functions

```{r}
map_dbl(df, mean)
map_dbl(df, median)
map_dbl(df, sd)
```

---

## Map functions

```{r}
map_dbl(df, mean, na.rm = TRUE)
```

--

```{r}
df %>%
  map_dbl(mean, na.rm = TRUE)
```

# Iteration in data frames with `across()`

---

# Single column

```{r}
#| label = "cp-mean-single-column"
car_prices %>%
  summarize(Price = mean(Price))
```

---

# Multiple columns

```{r}
#| label = "cp-mean-all-columns"
car_prices %>%
  summarize(
    Price = mean(Price),
    Mileage = mean(Mileage),
    Cylinder = mean(Cylinder),
    Doors = mean(Doors),
    Cruise = mean(Cruise),
    Sound = mean(Sound),
    Leather = mean(Leather),
    Buick = mean(Buick),
    Cadillac = mean(Cadillac),
    Chevy = mean(Chevy),
    Pontiac = mean(Pontiac),
    Saab = mean(Saab),
    Saturn = mean(Saturn),
    convertible = mean(convertible),
    coupe = mean(coupe),
    hatchback = mean(hatchback),
    sedan = mean(sedan),
    wagon = mean(wagon)
  )
```

---

```{r}
#| echo = FALSE
include_graphics(path = "/img/dplyr_across.png")
```

---

## `dplyr::across()`

`across()` has two primary arguments:

* `.cols`, selects the columns you want to operate on
* `.fns`, is a function or list of functions to apply to each column

---

## `summarize()`, `across()`, and `everything()`

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Single function]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-everything"
car_prices %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = everything(), .fns = mean))
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[Multiple functions]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-everything-fns"
car_prices %>%
  summarize(across(everything(), .fns = list(min, max)))
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[Multiple named functions]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-everything-fns-named"
car_prices %>%
  summarize(across(everything(), .fns = list(min = min, max = max)))
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[Grouped by]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-everything-group-by"
car_prices %>%
  group_by(Cylinder) %>%
  summarize(across(everything(), .fns = mean))
```
]

]

---

## `worldbank`

```{r}
#| label = "worldbank"
data("worldbank", package = "rcis")
worldbank
```

---

## `summarize()`, `across()`, and `where()`

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[Single condition]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-where"
worldbank %>%
  group_by(country) %>%
  summarize(across(.cols = where(is.numeric), .fns = mean, na.rm = TRUE))
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[Compound condition]
```{r}
#| label = "summarize-across-compound"
worldbank %>%
  group_by(country) %>%
  summarize(across(
    .cols = where(is.numeric) & starts_with("perc"),
    .fn = mean, na.rm = TRUE
  ))
```
]

]

---

## `across()` and `mutate()`

```{r}
#| label = "mutate-across"
car_prices %>%
  mutate(across(.cols = Price:Doors, .fns = log10))
```

---

## ~~`across()`~~ and `filter()`

.panelset[
.panel[.panel-name[`if_any()`]
```{r}
#| label = "filter-if-any"
worldbank %>%
  filter(if_any(everything(), ~ !is.na(.x)))
```
]

.panel[.panel-name[`if_all()`]
```{r}
#| label = "filter-if-all"
worldbank %>%
  filter(if_all(everything(), ~ !is.na(.x)))
```
]

]
